cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 75 mi south of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest toward southeastern Louisiana today, then turning north and northeast inland over Louisiana and Mississippi Monday-Tuesday

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Intracoastal City LA to the mouth of the Pearl River (LA-MS); Tropical Storm Watch: none for TX coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Intracoastal City LA to the mouth of the Pearl River; Tropical Storm Warning: Cameron LA to west of Intracoastal City LA and mouth of Pearl River to AL/FL border
weather_observation.impacted_coast: southeast Louisiana, Mississippi, and portions of Alabama coastal areas; minor impacts possible far SW Louisiana and upper TX coast
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤15%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; gusty squalls possible Sunday–Monday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft of inundation possible Sabine Pass to Pecan Island, which includes the Beaumont/Port Arthur area
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of outer-band rainfall possible Sunday–Monday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rip currents and rough seas on approaches/anchorages Sunday–Monday
